pr_title: [KOGITO-1559] Data Index service refactoring to support alternative storage solution

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+package org.kie.kogito.index.protobuf;

timeline.bodyText: This most likely only works if you have two implementations. What if you have multiple? Or even further, how do you plan for data index to use different persistence, build time, runtime config, profiles, etc?
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: Quarkus has a new feature to enable beans for quarkus build profile at build time. We can use that if choosing persistence at build time is acceptable.
replies.author: xieshenzh

replies.bodyText:
I thought the idea for data-index service was to treat it as a black box, that you just run. I am not sure users should rebuild it, I mean: we should discuss it further.
i.e. we may have separate backends; but I would expect users to "plug" them. Of course, this may make native compilation a bit less trivial; in this case we should either ship a binary with everything tacke in, or ship pre-built binaries.
The alternative may be we don't use native compilation for data-index and just run it in JVM mode; then we should be able to exploit dynamic loading as usual.
replies.author: evacchi

replies.bodyText: @evacchi changed it to choose persistence at runtime with application.properties. Thanks.
replies.author: xieshenzh

timeline.bodyText: will other db implementations also depend on protobuf?
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: I think other DB implementation will need the indexing information from the protobuf files. In addition, GraphQL currently also needs the information for the configurations related to domain models.
replies.author: xieshenzh

timeline.bodyText: Shall we make the string value as either a constant or enum value?
timeline.author: rhtevan

timeline.bodyText:
You are using a CDI qualifier even to promote a specific instance to be injected but this impose to client code to know add a qualifier everywhere.
What about preserve only Storage?
This means:

add Storage qualifier in this class where Instance<CacheService> and Instance<ProtobufCacheService> are injected
remove Default qualifier to InfinispanCacheManager
remove StorageSupported both from producer and injection points

The result is that each implementation should be exposed as Storage qualified bean, then this producer will take all of them and produce the only default instance so it will be enough to Inject without any additional qualifier in customer code.
Wdyt?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: @danielezonca @rhtevan updated. Please take a look.
replies.author: xieshenzh

timeline.bodyText: Default should not be needed (see comment above)
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: @xiezhang7 Second thought on naming this qualifier. How does 'WithStorage' sound to you? Instead of using two qualifiers, perhaps could try to use just one qualifier, 'WithStorage' with member value like: 'configured', 'mongo', 'ispn' etc., and default to 'configured'.
timeline.author: rhtevan

timeline.bodyText: @xiezhang7 How about name it as 'WithStorageQualifier' or 'WithStorageLiteral'?
timeline.author: rhtevan

timeline.bodyText: @xiezhang7 Maybe not needed.
timeline.author: rhtevan

timeline.bodyText: @xiezhang7 How about use an enum type with values?
timeline.author: rhtevan

timeline.bodyText: @xiezhang7 Could try @Any.
timeline.author: rhtevan

timeline.bodyText:
what is the purpose of fileName here? It's being used just in the firing event?
EDITED:
There are several invocations of the method with fileName="", I'd argue for the method overload to make fileName optional, plus swap the order of arguments (to have the optional on the right).
Plus I could really use javadoc for this (or these) method(s) to quickly spot the difference of use cases.
timeline.author: jstastny-cz

replies.bodyText: fileName is not really needed according to the original design. I'll revert this method signature change.
replies.author: xieshenzh

timeline.bodyText:
What does it really mean passing the empty string? IMO a overloaded method would be better (including the swapped order of args):
registerProtoBufferType(String content, String fileName)
registerProtoBufferType(String content)
timeline.author: jstastny-cz

timeline.bodyText: Didn't we want to throw ProtobufValidationException added above?

replies.bodyText:
ProtobufValidationException is not part of the API. It is in the data-index-storage-protobuf module.
But data-index-storage-infinispan module doesn't need  data-index-storage-protobuf as dependency.
Eventually the exception will be converted to ProtobufValidationException by ProtobufService at line 106.

timeline.message: [KOGITO-1559] pull request changes for protobuf module

timeline.author: cristianonicolai
cristianonicolai
cristianonicolai

timeline.bodyText: @xiezhang7 if you fire both events here, we might endup registering domains for proto files that are invalid, I would recommend keeping the logic and order that these events were handled.
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: @cristianonicolai The events are fired synchronously. If the execution of the first event throws an exception, the execution of the second event won't take place. I have added test to verify that, and also another test to make sure exception is thrown if the proto files are invalid.
replies.author: xieshenzh
